decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be on site until and no longer than 31 January 2027, unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority. 
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Drawings numbers: 23069_PL(2-)001_02, 23069_PL(2-)002_04, 23069_PL(2-)003_04, 23069_PL(2-)052_01, 23069_PL(2-)200_03, 23069 - PL(2-) 202 _01
Documents titled: 
- Cover Letter, prepared by: Geraldeve, ref: ANE/AKG/BFA/U0024270, dated 5/02/2024 
- Flood Risk Assessment, ref: 24005-FRA-TN-01 _P01, dated 05/02/2024
- Design and Access Statement, ref: Padel Yard - Design and Access Statement November 2023.
- Desktop Preliminary Risk Assessment, prepared by: JPP, ref: R-PRA-26818-01-00, dated: 29/04/2024.
- Floodlighting Lighting Impact Study, prepared by: Halliday Lighting, ref: 02433, dated: 01/05/2024. 
- Proposed Floodlighting (Lightspill Plan), prepared by: Halliday Lighting, drawing number: HLS7415 Rev2, dated 10/10/2024
- Flood light specifications: from: Siteco: Order No: 5XA7781E4A1A, GTIN (EAN): 4058352852491, product description: FL21 iQmd, PL43, 28730Im740, Comf, bracket. 
- Fire Strategy Design Note, prepared by BB7, ref: 16958BC - Padel Yard Wandsworth Rev 01, dated, 15/12/2023
- Noise Impact Assessment, prepared by: Chris Wood Acoustics, ref: 216_01M_2-0_CWA, dated: 23/12/2023. 
- Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, prepared by: Greengage, ref: 552598ohDec23FV01_PEA.docx, dated: December 2023
- Transport Statement, prepared by: Caneparo Associates , dated December 2023]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of: 07:00 to 23:00 Monday to Sunday. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan  coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 4 - Within 8 weeks from the date of this permission, the cycle parking shown on the approved drawing shall be provided, and be retained for cycle parking purposes for the users of the development and for no other purpose.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for cycle parking in accordance with Council policies LP2, LP37, LP51, PM2, PM3, PM4, PM6, PM7, PM8 and PM9 of the Wandsworth Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 5 - Within 8 weeks from the date of this permission, notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans and set out in the supporting information, a Landscape and Ecological Enhancement and Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Plan shall include details of all measures to provide biodiversity gain, including but not limited to:
- details of native and known wildlife friendly planting, including night scented species in the planters;
- the orientation, target species and location for 2x bat box/brick to be attached to any buildings or strucutres;
- a bat sensitive lighting plan to ensure that any lighting will be of a specification that minimises its impacts on bats, onsite habitats and adjacent habitats in accordance with the BCT and ILP 2023 Guidance Note (including having a colour temperature of no more than 3000k, measures to reduce light spill onto vegetated areas as much as possible, no light spill onto the the River Wandle including the edge of habitate).
  
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and biodiversity value in the development, in accordance with Council policies LP1, LP2 and LP56 of the Local Plan. The details are required prior to the commencement of works to ensure the landscaping measures are incorporated in the layout and construction of the development.
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Erection of 3 x padel courts with associated fencing, floodlighting, ancillary retail/security booth, use of land for a pickleball court and other associated works for a temporary period until 31 January 2027 (retrospective)
